title: About
text:
I am a Master of Business Analytics student at Monash University, originally from New Delhi, India. My academic and professional journey reflects a strong interest in how data-driven thinking can shape smarter, evidence-based decisions.
Before beginning my master’s, I worked in the investment industry at Aditya Birla Sun Life AMC, where I learned how data and analytics underpin financial strategy, portfolio management, and client insights. This experience built my appreciation for how numbers tell meaningful stories when translated effectively.
I’m particularly passionate about transforming complex data into clear, actionable narratives through analytics and visualisation. My studies have strengthened my foundation in statistics, programming, and communication, helping me explore the full process — from data wrangling to interpretation and presentation.
Beyond university, I enjoy playing basketball, going to the gym, baking, and travelling. These interests keep me balanced and curious — qualities I believe also drive thoughtful analysis and problem-solving.



Data & Code: R (tidyverse, ggplot2, Quarto), Python (pandas), Git/GitHub

Analysis: data visualisation, exploratory data analysis (EDA), model evaluation, and reproducible pipelines

Communication: concise analytical writing, clear figure design, and stakeholder-focused reporting





Developing high-quality, publication-ready reports using R and Quarto with strong documentation and cross-referencing

Enhancing my ability to translate analytical findings into strategic business insights

Building collaborative and reproducible workflows that promote transparency and team efficiency




This site showcases selected coursework and mini-projects from my analytics journey at Monash University. It’s an evolving space where I continue to refine my writing, visualisation style, and coding practices as I grow as an analyst.
